_source.title: Lead React Native developer needed - New MVP build for Pet Telehealth Startup - Upwork
_source.content: Who we are: We are Thought&Function (https://thoughtandfunction.com), a London based digital consultancy for startups founded by three entrepreneurial software engineers. We apply design thinking, lean and agile methodologies to help early-stage startups define and deliver their MVPs and iterate to find product/market fit. What the deliverable is: We're working with a new startup in the Pet Telehealth space, contributing to UX and design and owning the build of their backend and frontend application. This project is to work with one of our architects/leads to define and implement the React Native application and CI and release pipeline. The core functionality of the MVP release will contain: - auth (Firebase) - notifications (Emails, Push, and In-App) - content delivery from a developer-friendly CMS (Prismic) - payment (Stripe) - appointments & video conferencing (Leveraging Twilio as the video conferencing solution) The primary and highest priority deliverable is the MVP release, however, we also intend to modularise/componentise as much of the solution as possible to speed up delivery of future projects with similar requirements. Type of freelancer we're looking for: We're looking for an experienced lead React Native developer who will be able to take ownership of the React Native delivery, including the testing and release process to the Play Store and App Store. Must have tech experience: Typescript ReactNative Apollo Client Twilio integration Payment - Stripe / In-App Purchases AppCenter for CI and automated releases Firebase: Auth, Cloud Messaging Nice to have experience: Frontend - ReactJS, NextJS, Styled Components, Styled System, Chakra Your responsibilities: 1. To understand and ensure the goals of the MVP are met 2. To implement and release a high-quality MVP 3. To ensure the React Native implementation is delivered on time and on budget 4. To work with the architect and PM to highlight and minimise risks How the project will be delivered/managed: People: Architect/Technical Product Manager, PM, You Workflow: Kanban using JIRA Phased releases defined with the team An architect/technical product manager from Thought&Function will work part-time (1/5 time) on the project. They will work with you to architect an MVP solution that achieves the MVP goals and is within budget. They will also ensure blockers are removed. The architect/technical product manager will populate the backlog and ensure tickets have enough details, any supporting information and acceptance criteria. They will work with you to estimate the tickets. Regular meetings will be arranged to keep the project on track and running smoothly. Phased releases will be defined by the team, demoed to the client when appropriate. The UX wireframes will be ready but the final UI designs won't be. This project is therefore likely to occur in 2 phases: 1. Setup solution, release pipeline, routing, views, state management, API integration and 3rd party integrations 2. Implement final designs Hourly Range: $30.00-$50.00 Posted On: January 27, 2021 18:07 UTC Category: Mobile App Development Skills:JavaScript, TypeScript, Firebase, React Native, React, In-App Purchases, Payments, Offline, User Authentication, API Integration, Camera, Push Notifications Country: United Kingdom click to apply

_source.title: React / Python (Django) expert to join health tech startup --> 40+ hours / week 🚀 - Upwork
_source.content: A Little About Us... At Rupa Health (www.rupahealth.com), we’re on a mission to fundamentally improve the health of every person on the planet. We see functional medicine as the missing piece for millions of people suffering from chronic health conditions. That’s why we are committed to creating the technology for this thriving area of scientifically-backed integrative healthcare. We’re building the infrastructure for the next generation of medicine. Our first product is the Rupa Labs portal. Rupa Labs makes it super simple for functional medicine practitioners to order, dispense, and receive results from 20+ lab companies in one place. It is essential infrastructure for functional medicine practitioners, turning an archaic 15 hour-a-week process into a delightful 15 min task. With Rupa, practitioners can get back to what’s important - helping people get well! We’re backed by and work closely with our world class investors: First Round Capital, Mike Maples / Floodgate, Ron Conway / SV Angel, Joe Montana, Hustle Fund, healthcare domain experts, former founders with successful exits, the product brains behind Gmail, Facebook newsfeed, Dropbox, and more. We’re also fortunate to be advised by the best in the industry, including the Head of Health and co-founder of IDEO, the co-founder of Honor HomeCare, domain experts with backgrounds from Harvard, Stanford, MIT, Johns Hopkins, and more. We’ve been growing like crazy this year, with exponential month-over-month growth. To help fuel this rapid growth we’ve recently closed a round from First Round Capital, one of the top venture capital firms in the world. A company is only as good as its people, and so we’re looking for a Head of Marketing who can join us on this fast-paced journey. So, what’s the role? You’ll be joining the Rupa Health product and engineering team! We’re a close-knit, scrappy, and hardworking small team, and that means we’re looking for talented engineers who can offer more than just code. You’ll work closely with the founding team to iterate on the Rupa Labs portal and build delightful new features for our practitioners and patients. There’s a lot of unexplored territory in this space, and we’ll be relying on your ingenuity and problem-solving skills to come up with novel solutions that can scale. We’ll also be looking for you to provide your thoughts on the product direction and UX design. As an early engineer, you’ll be able to grow as a leader in your role and define the technical direction and vision for the company. You’ll have a lot of autonomy, responsibility, and ownership. You’ll also help define and contribute to the culture of the company as a whole. You’ll be working directly with our technical co-founder who has 10+ years of experience coding, founding startups, and building multiple products in the health / wellness space. What we're looking for - At least 3-5 years of professional software engineering experience creating frontend and backend applications. - Ready and able to jump straight into building in ReactJS and Django. Ideally you have experience with AWS and Postgres too. - Experience working in other early-stage tech startups. Bonus points if you’ve been a founder! - Ability to move fast and write code with a startup mindset. - Being able to take a broadly defined task and implement it without every aspect being laid out for you. - Security-by-design mindset. Let’s keep our patients’ data safe. - A passion for functional medicine and creating the infrastructure for the future of healthcare. Current Team You’ll be joining our all-star founding team who have 10+ years experience in the space, have won awards for their biotech research, worked hands on with chronically ill patients, and much more. The founding team comes from Stanford, Wharton, Parsley Health, Lululemon, Everlywell, Coffee Meets Bagel and more. We each have very personal reasons for wanting to transform this space. We’ve experienced firsthand the impact functional medicine can have and are committed to this cause. Beyond our collective excitement for the space, we’re a super close team who values personal development, being active, growth mindsets, a great sense of humor, and a healthy balance of optimism and realism. We work hard and have a ton of fun. 🙌 If this sounds like you, we’re stoked to meet you! Hourly Range: $20.00-$45.00 Posted On: February 04, 2021 23:40 UTC Category: Full Stack Development Skills:Web Application, React, Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Very Small (1-9 employees), Startup Country: United States click to apply

_source.title: WebPortal for Network Testing API - Phase 1 - Upwork
_source.content: About Us: We are highly experienced technical people with decades of experience in network management. We are focused on building a network testing system called SEAssure that allows other companies to test their communication networks. We have built an MVP for the SEAssure API already in past few months. What we need: We require assistance in building a WebPortal on top of our SEAssure API to show usage of the system. This would allow our customers to have a UI/UX for using our API without doing any development. We have a backend system called SEAssure that provides the following APIs: - A secure API that is used to request testing of communications network quality. - The SEAssure system returns back the test result via a callback after the test is completed. - SEAssure also has API to create new customers for the API and generate access keys for using the API. - Backend should be able to manage user signups and login as in every generic web portal. All in all there are 6 endpoints in the API at this moment in phase 1. What we need is a BackendForFrontend (BFF) and a FrontEnd itself which means full stack development. The basic requirements of the system are: 1- Users can signup using email/password combination. 2- Users can request a new password in case forgotten. 3- System can generate access keys for the SEAssure API for the user and stores it securely. (We can guide on how to do that). 4- System allows a simple form to create a test and call the SEAssureAPI endpoint. 5- System is able to receive callback and store the result of the test for that user and for that specific test. 6- A reporting page where users can see all the test results in a tabular form. _source.title: Digital Freight Network  - Upwork
_source.content: Hi, We are a freight brokerage company that works with numerous shippers and carriers. We want to develop our own platform to compete with Platforms such as DAT load board and convoy. This industry has a lot of flaws and inconsistencies and one that needs disruption.  The platform's job is to make freight seamless to deal with by incorporating technology. Somethings we want to incorporate into the platforms are Live load tracking, Carriers, and shippers should be able to see the status of the load live. We want to use an AI to determine shipment pricing instantly, this way it eliminates back and forth phone calls or emails. Pricing for shipments should be seamless for our shippers or co brokers. We want to also use Ai to connect empty trailers to carriers. For Ex: Shipper ABC needs to move the empty trailer from NY to CA, within 1 week. But to pay a lot of money for the empty trailer is not economically viable for the shipper. So the solution is our carrier will pick up the empty trailer and use the trailer to haul loads from a different shipper that is going to CA from NY. This can enable loads to be covered instantly for carriers and shippers. There a lot of complexity involved in the project that we can discuss in detail. _source.title: URGENT: Need a Sr Java developer to work on pure JAVA 8 proof-of-concept workflow app - Upwork
_source.content: we have a set of POJO models, with mandatory fields and dependencies on each other. For example: class Client {​     @NotBlank     string Name;     Address homeAddress;     List<Order> orders; }​ etc. As step 1 (this project), we need to create a relatively generic workflow which will allow us to enter all this data via "generic" input/output way. For example, one way to look at it would be a console application (System.in / System.out). Or this can be a RESTful API service. Or something else. We need this abstracted. So first step would be console (to simplify testing/debugging). I need you to create an app which can be straightforwardly extended to support multiple models with multiple fields. Referencing the model above, I need a way to write something like this: List<Field> addressFields = Arrays.asList(   new Field("Entering new address...", Address::new, required: true, ...),   new Field("Please enter street:", Address::setStreet, required: true, ...),   new Field("Please enter street2:", Address::setStreet2, required: false, ...),   ... );   List<Field> clientFields = Arrays.asList(   new Field("Entering new client...", Client::new, required: true, ...),   new Field("Please enter client name:", Client::setName, required: true, ...),   new Field("Please enter client address:", Client::setAddress, fields: addressFields, required: false, ...),   new Field("Please enter client orders:", Client::setOrders, required: false, min: 0, max: 10, ...), );   Client c = new WorkflowEngine(System.in, System.out).ReadData(clientFields); and this code will write into console something like this (where ">" denotes INPUT data): Entering new client... Please enter client name: > John Please enter client address:    Entering new address...    Please enter street:    > 20 Main St ... and when it's all done, i will have properly populated POJO object in the code. this is just a pseudocode of course but I hope you got the idea. I gave you a very simple set of fields (Client, Address, Order from the example above) but we have about 50 models with 250 fields we need to use. I don't want to use reflection - but I'm okay with entering 1 line per field as show above - and your code must be able to understand when inner field is a complex object (eg Address) or simple one (eg String) and process input/output accordingly. This all must be done in JAVA 8. I need somebody how can start on this ASAP (like today) and produce working app by the end of the week (so ~40 hours or so). Requirements are quite simple: * separate POJOs from logic; * use Lomboc and javax.validation on models (because we already have these models set up like that) * use reflection (or any other way) to determine attributes (@NotNull, @Size(1, 5), etc) dynamically - so we don't have to re-enter them * use console for input/output for now (but keep create an interface to hide this) * ability to resolve optional fields - and input for those may be omitted (eg by reading empty input) * there will be no circular dependencies Please let me know if you can start ASAP, if you have any questions, and if you can commit to at least 3 hours interlap with 9am-5pm EST hours. NOTE: there is no databases, webservices, etc etc - PURE JAVA project. BUT I do have a requirement to use streams, functional references etc - you must be well aware about functional programming etc because I believe right approach will help to make the final code smaller and easier to understand. Hourly Range: $27.00-$50.00 Posted On: February 08, 2021 00:22 UTC Category: Back-End Development Skills:Java Country: Canada click to apply

_source.title: Developer needed to help automate back-end processes of Wordpress website - Upwork
_source.content: We're a company that records youth games. We have a website that works but needs an overhaul in certain areas: Order Page: Clients type the information (date, time, place, team name, etc.) of the game that they want us to record. Once they do this, they pay by credit card or paypal. We use WooCommerce for this functionality. Issues: 1. Client should be able to type the date or choose from a calendar. So far, choosing is the only option. 2. Client should be able to choose previous dates. 3. When a client needs several games to be recorded, the autofill option fills out all fields when it should be just selected fields. 4. The bulk pricing option used to work and it no longer does. 5. We would like to capture all the client information in a database that we can manipulate to analyse our clients and be able to reachout back to them. We can't do this currently. Once the client places the order, it goes into a database that we need to be able to sort. It is from this database that we assign to the videographers the games that they will record. Since a single order can have several games to record, we need to break this order and list the games in this database individually. We assign the games to videographers by date and by address (park). We need assistance with the following tasks: 1. The assigning of the games to the videographer is one at a time. We would like to check several games and assign them to a single videographer. Having said this, we need to be able to type individual instructions for each game. if the videographer missed the email, we need to be able to re-send it. 2. If a videographer can't make a specific game, we need to be able to re-assign it to another videographer. 3. The email that the videographer receives does not sort the games chronologically. It also has an awkward layout. 4. Videographer needs to be able to reply to the email to confirm receipt. There is a lot of coding that is needed to fix these issues. If you're not an expert coder, please don't apply. We're happy the way it looks but would like to significantly improve the website's backend functionality. Make it as automated as possible with the ability to analyze our clients' info. _source.title: Need an update of an Industrial IoT data dashboard - Upwork
_source.content: We are a 3D-printing construction company that has multiple machines that are allocated in work cells. Each work cell is dedicated to a particular manufacturing process. The produced parts have a unique ID number which allows an operator to identify the part and read the data generated during the manufacturing process. All collected information is stored in one database and available via a web portal. As the user interface and front-end, we use the ThigsBoard web application, and on the backend, we have AWS instances with Aurora database and IoT gateway. The current system needs to get a clear user flow with simple access to collected data. A more technical description of the task is listed below: There are several parts of the system (see picture attached): - The data logger module. It’s deployed on a dedicated computer on-site. It has a set of drivers to talk to industrial equipment. Then it converts all collected data from the equipment to required formats, packs it, and sends packets to an AWS instance via ThingsbBoard API - The data acquisition module. It’s located on the AWS instance which allows it to receive data from the data logger module and save the data to the database for further processing. Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL is used as a database engine. - The frontend module. It’s located on the same AWS instance which contains a web-server with all necessary web-pages including dashboards, user accounts, data charts, widgets, etc. The report generation module. It makes SQL-requests to the database, creates special reports using specific templates, and saves reports on FTP-server. - FTP-server is a storage of all necessary files related to the product. What we need: Using the ThingsBoard framework create additional web-pages and/or custom widgets that will improve access to data and overall usability, e.g.: - Show the list of already completed jobs indicating which stages were completed, - Show the Work in Progress list of jobs indicating at which stage the part is currently is. - For every part production request need to show what job should be done - Show parts specification and metadata from database and FTP - Add fields like “Operator notes/comments” for manual text inputs and adding files, which should be saved into the FTP-server database and associated with a particular part produced - Push button to generate a new report with the actual data, notes, and attached files - Show links to files related to the part. What we need you to do (should be discussed before execute) - Create an integrated web-page or a custom widget that allows users to get the list of jobs done with access to necessary information, files, and reports - Create SQL-requests to get all necessary information from the current Database and to add all new information, links to the database - Create algorithms to upload files to FTP-server How we want to check the outcome - The final result should be a web-portal with multiple pages that allow performing actions described above. - A user should be able to open added web-pages via the ThingsBoard dashboard. - The developed web-pages should allow finding the required information or file(s) related to the produced parts. - Links on web-pages related to produced parts should allow downloading the correct file(s), notes, pictures, and other data, depends on the link context - Each web-page associated with a produced part should allow information editing such as adding new files, downloading existing files, manually entering notes, generate reports, etc. - The resulting code has to be uploaded to our Github repository. Improvements are deployed to the main server. We are using the following technologies: - Amazon EC2 web service is as a back-end engine - Data processing and visualization is based on the ThingsBoard IoT platform - Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL as a database storage Format: We are working in two-week sprints and the final product should be released by mid-March. We will require to participate in daily 5-10min meetings to coordinate the work with the rest of the team. Hourly Range: $15.00-$50.00 Posted On: February 02, 2021 13:23 UTC Category: Full Stack Development Skills:Database Architecture, Database Design, Web Application, API, Java, Amazon Aurora, Responsive Design, AWS Application Country: Russia click to apply

This is a remote position, so you’ll also need to be a self-starter who can think on your feet and show initiative. You’ll have a great work ethic, excellent time-management and communication skills and, of course, a fast computer and internet connection. Who we are: We’re a fast-paced, remote team spread across a couple of continents. We’re friendly, fun, active and team who shows initiative. Our collective goal is to help others, and we know this begins with having great teamwork. The perfect fit for our team would be: - First and foremost, an expert in all things Shopify - from behind-the-scenes functionality through to providing a great user experience. However, we also need someone that can assist us on all things IT related. - Confident in your skills and experience, and be willing to provide valuable insights in team meetings to help our brand make a positive impact on more people. - Can think on your feet and show initiative, but will also ask for team support to get things done. You’ll also need to multitask and communicate through Slack and Zoom. Your roles would include: - Customising, building and maintaining Shopify stores - Manage all customisation requests from our team - Able to design and create beautiful landing pages (with assistance from our creatives team) - Address and fix issues in website functionality quickly - Select and manage appropriate Shopify apps - Write appropriate scripts - Assist in importing files and data and making sure Analytics reports are showing accurate data - Ensure optimal performance from servers through to ‘cleaning up’ behind the scenes in Shopify - Integrate programs and applications - Handle IT access for other staff during the onboarding and offboarding process You’ll have experience in: - Web development (especially Shopify, a dash of Wordpress is needed too) - Programming - Web server performance optimization - Basic UX design - Basic SEO - Joomla - Google Suite and Microsoft Programs - Slack, Trello and Zoom - Coding You’ll be assisting: - Our fulfillment team - to ensure that the right info is sent through when customers place orders - Our customer experience team - to fix and eliminate issues highlighted through their interactions with customers - Our marketing team - to create attractive landing pages and website adjustments related to promotions and ‘keeping it fresh’ We saved the best for last - the perks of working with us: - Work from home - Flexible schedule and holidays - Fantastic collaborative environment - Friendly, vibrant team Love the sound of being a part of our team? We’d love to learn more about your skills. Drop us your cover letter and Resume and we’ll be in touch soon. _source.title: [Java/React/TypeScript]Senior Fullstack developer needed for Implementing Features on Form Publisher - Upwork
_source.content: Company/Product We are a profitable software company that makes SaaS products used by millions of users worldwide. Form Publisher lets you generate documents from Google Docs templates and Google Forms answers, that get directly stored and sent and shared in Google Drive to the people you want. It is one of the very top Google Marketplace add-on. Thousands of organisations and millions of people use it to automate tedious business processes, such as generating purchase requests, invoices, quotes, certificates, and much more. Our product values are: customer delight, simplicity and empowerment. As such, Form Publisher is ready for a solid UI and UX revamp. Our team is global (we have people based in France, Italy, Serbia, Bulgaria, Russia, US, Philippines, UK, Ireland), highly motivated and competent. We are a remote first company: anyone can work fully remotely. We also have offices in Paris and Milan if that’s more your thing. We are growing quickly, and looking for new talent that will help us reach new heights. Job Would you like to work on a product with millions of users? Do you like the possibilities offered by new cloud technologies, especially serverless? You’ve knocked at the right door. We are looking for a highly motivated Senior Programmer to join our growing team! The Senior Programmer is responsible for the development of subsystems of a product across the stack. You will join a small passionate team, and will be able to have a high impact. We expect you to help us take our products and our team to the next technical level and to teach us something we don’t know. You will report to the Lead Engineer and work closely with the Product and Support teams. Our infrastructure is entirely on the cloud on Google Cloud Platform. We use Firebase, Cloud Functions, PostgreSQL. We code in Javascript, Typescript, Google Apps Script and Java. Core responsibilities: * Implementing substantial features, fixing bugs * Writing technical specifications * Proactively proposing code and performance improvements * Helping set and maintain a high professional standard Some examples projects that you could work on: * Implementing new workflow features * Implementing notification features * Building an entirely new add-on * Implementing an external-facing API * Improving the billing system * Rebuilding our marketing website * Improving performance of a specific component Some examples of what we did in the last few months alone: * Refactored the entire UI from static HTML and vanilla JS to React, opening up the stage for hot reloading and external components * Started adding Unit/Functional tests and connected them to the build process * Automated the build and deployment process * Completely refactored outdated code * Added code styling tools * Added different environments and steps for the development and testing processes * Increased release frequency * Made several features We are always open to new suggestions and ideas for improvement. Due to the relatively flat structure of the company, it is easy to implement the accepted ideas! You: * You care more about making reliable software used by many than a shiny unstable thing used by no one. You understand that engineering work is done first and foremost for the customers. * You care a lot about performance, understand that speed and responsiveness is a core feature * Fully capable of taking substantial features from concept to shipping as the sole programmer * Deep expertise with at least one programming environment * Generally full-stack, with definite front-end experience * You’re a fan of spreadsheets and their programming paradigm * You’re a team player Qualifications: * Experience: 5-8 years as a professional programmer on SaaS products * Cloud: you have experience with one of the 3 main cloud platforms. Bonus points for GCP and server-less experience * Programming languages: you have experience with Javascript, Typescript and React, and Java. * Software engineering tools: you’ve worked with git and Jira, you’re familiar with front-end build tools, benchmarking, CI/CD and profiling tools * Collaboration tools: comfortable with Gmail, Google Docs and Sheets, and Slack * Language: fluent in English * Writing: you enjoy writing, you care about words and grammar, you are sharp and thorough Hourly Range: $20.00-$45.00 Posted On: February 05, 2021 13:12 UTC Category: Full Stack Development Skills:Java, TypeScript, React Country: France click to apply

_source.title: Socket IO and WEb RTC Expert needed to fix Real-time video calling features web app - Upwork
_source.content: Hello We have a web app and Native iOS and Android app. Web app stack: front end: Angular backend: NodeJS database: MySQL ios: Swift android: java Problem: The core feature of the app is that a user can do a live video call from mobile app to the desktop app using VOIP. And we are using socket IO and Vonage video API to achieve this. However, we have many issues with the live call. One example is sometimes the call drops randomly and sometimes when user A calls user B, it will also call user C who is not even online. We have investigatedd that these issues are happening because of socket IO is not managed properly along with browser caching issues. Some times the socketIO connection stays on and get conflicted with other users. etc Solution part 1: We need someone who has extensive knowledge with Socket IO to debug the app and let us know whether the issue is really with socket IO or something else. the main reason for this part of work is to know that you are 100% clear whether you can carry on working and write the code to implement the fixes. Solution part  2: Once you are able to diagnose the issue and tell us that the issue is really with SocketIO and you are 100% clear and able to fix it, Then you will carry on working to implement the fixes so the minimum number of call issues can be resolved. Please only apply if you have worked with socket IO before. More preferably if you have worked with Vonage API and webRTC (link removed) Hourly Range: $20.00-$45.00 Posted On: February 08, 2021 10:14 UTC Category: Full Stack Development Skills:API, Web Application, Angular, AngularJS, Java, JavaScript, Apache HTTP Server, NGINX, RESTful, Node.js, WebRTC, Socket.io Country: Netherlands click to apply

_source.title: JavaScript Engineer Needed - Upwork
_source.content: Hello - We are a growing eCommerce company looking to hire on an expert in javascript.  This role is to help us maintain code and connection to several thermal printing hardware brands (Dymo, Zebra, Rollo, etc) with our web application so that our customers can print product and shipping labels. Preferred Knowledge Stack - mostly JavaScript, specifically asynchronous/Promise support. - ajax/fetch are a must for most deployments - knowledge of common gotchas (CORS, mixed content, proxies) - Python and React - Basic understanding of certs and private keys (cryptography), we use it for licensing - Remote desktop/TeamViewer/WebEx/VNC skills to reproduce issues not reproducible at the lab - Ability to start our program from command line and evaluate the logs - Documentation skills for support - Close communication with support ⚠️  Non-Negotiables ⚠️ This is an engineer role first and a support role second, but both are important.  We would need to ship a few thermal printers to you for unit testing, but we pay a small bonus each month for you to hold these printers for testing. Your time each week will be a mix of writing code, testing that code with several brands, helping with support tickets for any thermal printing problems and also documenting important code in our internal wiki. You would be a very important person on our team and depending on your tech stack, you could work on other parts of our application. _source.title: Developer required to create a website calculator system - Upwork
_source.content: Please do not contact us outwith Upwork. About us: We are a dynamic team of web designers, graphics/video experts, marketing specialists, and project managers who ensure our customers’ projects are carefully managed and tailored to their specific needs. We are looking for an expert WordPress developer to create a Calculator Questionnaire to be added to an existing WordPress website. You are required to have past, provable, experiences of successful development of a Calculator website on WordPress. Please do not apply to this job if you do not have any prior experience and success. The objective of this project is to build a web calculator that calculates the carbon footprints of an individual or an organisation. Users will login/create an account and answer a series of questions regarding their carbon footprint and will then be presented with a breakdown of their results in the form of graphs/pie-charts with comparisons to the national and worldwide average and some suggestions/tips on what they can do to improve. The results page will also have a leaderboard amongst friends. Users should be able to input a unique code to join a “league” with friends or colleagues. There will be two types of leaderboards, based on total carbon footprint and biggest improvement. All users should be able to save their information and be able to go back in at a later date to edit and update as they improve their carbon footprint. The calculator is to be built on the WordPress platform using PHP/HTML/CSS/Java etc. - we require your proposed method of coding before the project is started. The calculator website needs to be responsive i.e. it needs to work perfectly on laptop, tablet and mobile devices. You will develop this membership based Carbon Calculator on our development space. We will provide you with the PowerPoint slides and PDF files with the project scope and requirements. You will also receive the graphics/images to be used, text, calculations, tips and so on. You are required to provide timely and regular updates on the progression of the project. You need to document your code and work as you go forward with the project. You will be required to sign an NDA and the project cannot be used in your profile or portfolio or any other websites/emails etc. The project would be regarded as successful when we receive a responsive and user-friendly Carbon Calculator that strictly adheres to our requirements and is editable from the backend of the site so that it's easy to change formulas without editing code. In order to be considered, please answer the following fully: Answer all points by starting with their respective numbers below: 1. Mention the word "sausage" as the first word in your response. Failure to do this will result in your application being declined. 2. Please share a brief summary of your experience and tell us about the most complex WordPress Calculator website that you’ve built to date. Provide a few examples of your past work involving a Calculator website with links. 3. If you are interested in this job, please don't tell us to refer to your profile, detail in your application, don't simply copy and paste generic information. People skills: 1. Ability to communicate effectively 2. Understand written and spoken English to a high level to communicate with the team Above all, take pride in your work and provide a finished product that enhances you, your team, and the business. Provide a strong cover letter that gives as much detail as possible on how you feel you can help, and what your experience is re. above points. Please also provide a fixed price. We look forward to hearing from you. Regards… Kevin Hourly Range: $20.00-$45.00 Posted On: February 01, 2021 15:06 UTC Category: Full Stack Development Skills:Database Design, Website Development Country: United Kingdom click to apply

_source.title: Python Full Stack Developer needed for Design & Implement of a Microservices based Workflow Platform - Upwork
_source.content: We're a workflow consulting and software development company that focuses on Media Asset Management and Distribution. Video and the corresponding metadata management is the core of our business. During our consults, we tend to find shortcomings and gaps in our clients' workflows. This is where our cool tools come into play. We write all kinds of connectors, translators, data transformations, scrapers, etc. to bridge these gaps. In addition, we also do a lot of content publishing workflows. This video needs to be sent to that external system with this accompanying metadata. At this point, we have a pretty deep library of utilities to help with various tasks that come up. We're looking for flexible, fast-moving, and detail-oriented team members with strong communication skills. We have a core team of developers and we're looking for people to bring new experiences & tools to the team. Specifically, we are kicking off a new project and we are designing a platform that uses a microservices based architecture from the ground up. We're looking for team members who will be involved in the whole process, from design through implementation, and deployment for the customer. Python experience is a must. Javascript, REST APIs, and templating languages like Jinja2 are important areas to have experience. Celery, Java, Django, MongoDB, & GraphQL experience are all a big plus! Your responsibilities will include: Playing a key role in designing and implementing various microservices Contributing to all layers of our technology stack including back-end services, databases, APIs and web-based user interface Working with and supporting other technical team members Working with customers to troubleshoot technical issues Writing internal technical documentation Qualifications: Expert knowledge of programming concepts and object-oriented programming Experience architecting large applications Fluency in Python and JavaScript/TypeScript Experience (shallow ok) in other ‘back end’ languages: Golang, Node.js, etc... Familiarity with basic software design/architecture approaches such as:     SOLID principles     Clean Architecture     Domain Driven Design     12 Factor Docker (basic experience)     Kubernetes familiarity is a plus - not required Basic understanding of microservices architecture Familiarity with popular RDBMS system(s), i.e. Postgres, MySQL/MariaDB AWS experience a plus Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Git Familiarity with project management tools such as Jira Strong knowledge of web programming specifics and experience in building web-based applications (Django experience a plus) Expertise with client-side javascript and HTML based UI development Strong Linux skills Experience with web services, especially for facilitating interaction among multiple systems Excellent communication skills and fluency in English Additionally, we are seeking someone who is: Self-starting and can work autonomously in a larger team Committed to following best practices Keenly interested in developing technologies Enthusiastic about testing Able to learn quickly and take on new responsibilities as priorities change Organized and detail-oriented Hourly Range: $20.00-$45.00 Posted On: February 01, 2021 14:51 UTC Category: Full Stack Development Skills:API, Web Application, API Integration, Database Development, Project Analysis, React, Redux, RESTful, Docker, Python, TypeScript, JavaScript, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB Country: United States click to apply

_source.title: NFC library for accessing passport chip - Upwork
_source.content: We are developing a Xamarin application for Android and iOS and require access to the NFC chip on passport and ID cards. The default Xamarin NFC library we have tried to use doesn't seem to support a way to authenticate BAC authentication (Details on BAC below). This piece of work requires production of a simple demo Xamarin application that can run on both Android and iOS. Preference is for the developer must have a biometric passport (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biometric_passport) to allow testing locally. We require development to provide full access to the passport chip in both Android and iOS and to provide a way of accessing this through Xamarin. Xamarin application to have three screens 1. Enter details Passport Number, Expiry Date, Date of Birth > Next 2. Place phone on passport – read chip 3. Display results - including picture stored on chip Further info Similar Android app with this functionality and open source https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tananaev.passportreader&hl=en_US&gl=US https://github.com/tananaev/passport-reader Other working Java library that we have identified that can achieve this JMRTD: An Open Source Java Implementation of Machine Readable Travel Documents https://jmrtd.org/ Xamarin NFC project https://github.com/franckbour/Plugin.NFC BAC https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_control Hourly Range: $15.00-$40.00 Posted On: February 05, 2021 17:51 UTC Category: Mobile App Development Skills:Phone, Android, iOS, C#, Java, Xamarin, NFC Country: United Kingdom click to apply

Unfortunately, no unit or integration tests were created at the time and the team in question is expecting a lot of regression should they continue to ramp up development of the system in the future. The project is currently using Flyway for managing its database migrations. We are therefore looking for a senior developer experienced in Java/Spring and automated QA to help the team... 1) ...choose a strategy for automated integration testing. 2) ...create a basic set-up to run integration tests (on the level of the REST API) as part of CI/CD, preferably using an in-memory database (like H2) and some kind of DB fixture library to isolate the tests from each other as well as from the actual staging/production setup. 3) ...extend the test runner setup to include the measurement of code coverage. 4) ...build more and more integration tests until a certain code coverage has been reached. You will have to sign an NDA before you can start to work on this project. Please don't apply if you're not at least conversational in English and can make yourself available for video calls and Slack chats between 10am and 4pm CET. There is a possibility that you can join this or another of our teams permanently if the job goes well. Here's how we intend to recruit on this project: 1) You send in your application 2) We provide you with the NDA to sign 3) We provide you with a ZIP file containing a portion of the application's existing codebase (basically a multi-module Maven project). We then ask you to implement 1-2 API-level integration tests as a first test task. 4) You provide us with an estimate of how you think you'll need for this test task, and we award you the contract on Upwork (but capped at the agreed-upon budget, for now). 5) You submit your solution to our test task. 6) We review your solution together with the system architect on client-side and then get back to you with questions as required. 7) If things go as plan we will then lift the budget restriction and onboard you to the project for real (i.e. provide you with access to our VPN, Jira, Gitlab, ect.) Hourly Range: $20.00-$35.00 Posted On: February 08, 2021 15:55 UTC Category: Back-End Development Skills:RESTful API, Java, Git, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, H2, JUnit, CI/CD, Automatic Test Country: Luxembourg click to apply

_source.title: Reverse engineer C++ (x86) app / extract some function and convert to C# - Upwork
_source.content: Overview The “GILS” application written in C++ (x86) was used for installing, updating, and launching JAVA and Windows based applications delivered via Java-based server (WebLogic 5.1.0 Service Pack 9) back in 2000-2002. Objectives The focus is working with me to gain a better understanding of assembly, IDA Pro and the GILS application. An existing IDA Pro database will be used with many of the function names already translated into more readable English by myself. This should assist with analysing those functions of key interest noted in section 2 of the below list. The application be can be debugged up to a certain point until it requires a file which is missing, e.g. 2.spec.sig. Recreating the functions in C# should assist with further progression. Summary 1. To assist with me with understanding assembly: o Interpreting reading/writing of parameters o Function logic o When structs should be created and how they can be set o Your general approach for analysis o Answering any assembly questions which might come up during analysing the functions in section 2 below and developing the C# application 2. Interpreting the read functions in assembly which handle the below files and translate to C# (or detailed pseudo code) to be able to read and write these file types: o SIG Files o VER Files o SPEC Files Experienced Individual Requirements I am seeking someone who fits the following requirements. • Experienced in: o IDA Pro o Assembly o C# - not essential but clear and detailed pseudo code would be required for recreating assembly functions in C# • Paid hourly • Period required: o < 1 Month (opportunity for further work in the future) o 5 to 10 hours a week • Ideally available (London Time) sometime between 5pm and 11pm Weekday but can be negotiated • I have setup a VM for development which contains the required tools for analysing assembly, debugging the Gils application, and writing the C# code. I purpose we use TeamViewer Meeting for voice communication and screensharing. Further details in the attached document and please contact me if you have any questions. Hourly Range: $16.00-$35.00 Posted On: February 02, 2021 15:31 UTC Category: Desktop Software Development Skills:Desktop Applications, Windows, C#, C++, Reverse Engineering, X86 Assembly Language Country: United Kingdom click to apply
